data.title: These recent movies were filmed in Palm Springs and include actors Lady Gaga, Morgan Freeman, Bradley Cooper
data.meta_description: Thirteen movies have been filmed in Palm Springs since 2016 including one with A-list actors Bradley Cooper.
data.text:
Starring Palm Springs: Part 2 of 5

Palm Springs has historically been known as the playground to the stars. In the heyday of Hollywood film-making, there was something known as the “two-hour rule.”

Actors had to stay within two hours of Hollywood in case they were called in to work, so naturally Palm Springs, located within that boundary, fast became a popular destination.

While the resort city still remains a hot vacation spot, it is steadily becoming a place for top filmmakers and actors to visit for work as well.

A review of film permits since 2016 shows that 13 feature-length films have shot entire movies or scenes in Palm Springs.

STARRING PALM SPRINGS: Top locations | Music videos | TV shows | Fashion shoots

From Bradley Cooper in his directorial debut using the Palm Springs Convention Center as a venue where his character in “A Star is Born” performs, to veteran director Ron Shelton, known for “Bull Durham,” sending a film crew to get footage of the city so his movie “Just Getting Started” with Morgan Freeman could appear to take place in Palm Springs.

Here are the 13 films. Maybe you saw them being shot and didn't even know it:

'Valentine Dayz'

When filmed: Aug. 2016

Where: Moorten Botanical Garden, now-closed dish Creative Cuisine (Alebrije Bistro México is now open in that spot) and the 700-acre Palm Hills Movie Ranch, right above the Rimrock Shopping Center at Gene Autry Trail and Highway 111.

Stars: Dallas Valdez, Carrie Keagan, Robert Allen Mukes

Summary: Max and Sara just got engaged when a virus breaks out turning people into zombies.

Release date: Oct. 2017

Fun fact: The movie took three weeks to film and had its premiere at the Camelot Theatres in Palm Springs with many of the stars and production team present.

Trailer link: https://youtu.be/inDjAgR9JVo

RELATED: These are the most filmed Palm Springs places: Celebrity homes, resorts and distinctive landmarks

'Just Getting Started'

When filmed: Nov. 3 and 4, 2016

Where: The Palm Springs welcome sign, Indian Canyons Golf Resort and various streets including N. Rose and Cresent Dr, Las Palmas and Marison, South Palm Canyon Drive, North Palm Canyon Drive, Dillon Road, Tipton Road

Stars: Morgan Freeman, Tommy Lee Jones, Rene Russo

Summary: An ex-FBI agent and an ex-mob lawyer vie for the affection of the same woman while trying to fend off a mob hit.

Release date: Dec. 8, 2017.

Fun fact: The movie is set in a retirement community called Villa Capri in Palm Springs during the Christmas holiday, but it was mostly filmed in New Mexico. To make it seem like Palm Springs, another film crew filmed exterior shots of the Palm Springs-area desert which were then added to the movie to make it appear as though it did take place in the California desert.

Trailer link: https://www.imdb.com/videoproembed/vi1299822873

'American Exit'

When filmed: Aug. 22, 24, 25, 2016

Where: Villa Royale Inn; Angel View Thrift Store

Stars: Dane Cook, Levi Miller, Udo Kier, Claire van der Boom

Summary: A dying father takes a road trip with his son, to try to rebuild his relationship before he dies.

Release date: Summer 2019.

Fun fact: Kier is a desert resident with at least 200 film credits including significant roles in the classic “Europa” from 1991 and “Shadow of the Vampire” in 2000 and fun roles in comedies like "Ace Ventura: Pet Detective." More recently the German character actor has appeared in "Downsizing" with Matt Damon.

Trailer link: https://youtu.be/G-AKFs4cyE0

'The Assumptions'

When filmed: Aug. 21, 2016

Where: Sunrise Park

Stars: Brian Moore, Joan Hangarter, Diana Hintergardt, Marcus Lantero

Summary: A newborn baby is abandoned on the streets by his 14-year-old mother, what happens next will change the course of his destiny forever

Release date: February 2017.

Fun fact: The movie is directed by desert resident Gina Carey, a self-taught movie director with several movies under her belt.

Trailer link: http://a.co/6IUkX95

READ MORE: Self-taught desert movie maker is 'Mother Teresa' of local film industry

'A Star is Born'

When filmed: April 20, 21 and 22, 2017

Where: Palm Springs Convention Center

Stars: Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga

Summary: A musician helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.

Release date: Oct. 5.

Fun facts: In the scene filmed at the convention center, Cooper’s character, a washed up artist, is performing at a pharmaceutical convention because that's the only gig he can land.

Trailer link: https://youtu.be/4-tcHHyy1Rw

READ MORE: See 'A Star is Born' trailer with Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga in scenes shot on Coachella, Stagecoach stages

'I Think We’re Alone'

When filmed: April 28 and 29, 2017

Where: A home in the 400 block of Azul Circle; driving shots on Azul Circle, South Sierra Madre and East Canyon Vista Drive

Stars: Peter Dinklage, Elle Fanning, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Paul Giamatti

Summary: The apocalypse proves a blessing in disguise for one lucky recluse, until a second survivor arrives with the threat of companionship.

Release date: Sept. 21

Fun fact: The home on Azul Circle was designed by Palmer & Krisel and are located in the Canyon View Estates in South Palm Springs.

Trailer link: https://youtu.be/MJ3JP6AzAAM

'Can’t Have You'

When filmed: April 27, 28, 30 and May 1-12, 2017

Where: Palm Springs Film Alliance, The Saguaro, Zelda’s Nightclub, On the Rocks house on Camino Monte and a home in the 2000 block of Cantina Way.

Stars: Steve Agee, Viva Bianca, Madison Dylan and Johnathan Fernandez

Summary: A successful TV producer plans a destination wedding in Palm Springs bringing together a diverse group of his college friends in a reunion of sorts.

Release date: Undetermined.

Fun fact: The "On the Rocks" house used in the film is located in The Mesa neighborhood and has a casita with a graphic mural that depicts the B-52's song "Love Shack."

Trailer link: (None available)

'One Year Pact'

Filmed when: June 11, 2017

Where: Palm Springs Leisure Center, 401 South Pavillion Way.

Stars: Steven Ciceron, Domingo Winstead, Marcus Lantero, Brian Moore

Summary: A comedy about four irresponsible childhood friends who are forced to become responsible men.

Release date: February 2018.

Fun facts: The movie is directed by desert resident Gina Carey. In addition to being a self-taught movie director, she is also a musician who has had five No. 1 hits on the UK music charts.

Trailer link: https://vimeo.com/226519450

'The Unicorn'

When filmed: June 5-15, 2017.

Where: Twist Hotel, along North Palm Canyon and Via Lola, Demuth Community Center and a home in the 1000 block of East El Alameda,

Stars: Lauren Lapkis, Nicholas Rutherford, Lucy Hale, Beck Bennett, Beverly D’Angelo, Kyle Mooney.

Summary: An indecisive couple facing the fourth year of their engagement finally decides to take the next big step and have a threesome.

Release Date: March 10, 2018.

Fun fact: The director is Robert Schwartzman, whose mother is Talia Shire, brother is Jason Schwartzman, uncle is Francis Ford Coppola, and cousins are Nicholas Cage and Sofia Coppola.

Trailer link: https://youtu.be/Lw50zz8ONHo

'Acts of Kindness'

When filmed: April 22 and June 24, 2018

Where: Palm Springs Leisure Center

Stars: Steven Ciceron, Diana Hintergardt, Alexis Spencer

Summary: A family dramedy about three mysterious Superheroes that

go around doing Acts of Kindness in their community.

Release date: March 4, 2019

Fun facts: This is another Gina Carey film. She also launched the CV Indie Film Awards which provides local actors an opportunity to win awards and be recognized for their varying talents. The next CV Indie Film Awards are Oct. 8 in Rancho Mirage.

Trailer link: https://vimeo.com/278081330

Starring Palm Springs

Desert Sun columnist Xochitl Peña and producer Robert Hopwood reviewed almost 400 film permits issued since 2016 for everything from fashion photo shoots and music videos to commercials and feature films.

Wednesday: Among all the film permits issued since 2016, some locations have emerged as more popular than others. We share the most popular locations used for film and photography shooting in the city.

TODAY: Palm Springs has been known as Hollywood's playground. But for 13 feature films that shot scenes here — including the much anticipated "A Star is Born" remake with Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga — the resort city is the backlot.

Coming Friday: There's something seductive and adventurous about the desert that musicians love. There have been 13 music videos shot in Palm Springs including a fun one featuring a dancing Susan Sarandon.

Coming Saturday: Kim Kardashian and reality shows love Palm Springs. There have been at least 69 film permits issued for television shows including an episode of "Keeping Up with the Kardashians" featuring lots of sister bonding.
